description.narrative: The overall project objective is to improve the political participation of women in Gwanda and Umzingwane District by 2018. The immediate objective is to promote increased interest and active participation of women in political participation. The project also seeks to enhance the leadership capacity of women so as to improve their participation, competence, confidence and effectiveness in governance at local and national level.The project outcomes include: 1) Improved participation in parliament and in local authorities in influencing engendered policies. 2) Inclusive planning between women citizens and policy makers. 3) Improved knowledge of constitutional provisions among women leading to their active participation in politics.The project addresses the problem of marginalisation of women in political processes especially in policy making and decision making at local government and national level. The project is anchored on the realisation that women’s emancipation and empowerment can only be realised through full implementation of constitutional provisions that champion women’s rights and freedoms. Rights holders for this project mainly include are women aged between 18 and 65. They are the most affected by poor policies and they are excluded in key decision making platforms. The limited participation of women is a violation of their Constitutional rights which results in their marginalization and exclusion in development and political processes. This project mainly falls within the Democracy intervention area (strengthening democratic culture and women’s political participation objectives) in the current Diakonia Zimbabwe’s Strategic Plan for 2016-2020. It will be implemented by Women’s Institute for Leadership Development (WILD) in Umzingwane and Gwanda rural districts of Matabeleland South province.
This project mainly contributes to results within Women's political participation. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
